appg_groups.name: Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.purpose: The groups' mission is to (a) raise parliamentary awareness and public understanding of Genetic Haemochromatosis (GH), its prevalence and implications; (b) drive policy change to improve the welfare of GH patients across the UK; (c) influence ministers, parliamentarians, government bodies, policy-makers and NHS representatives to improve patient pathways through the UK healthcare and support systems.

appg_groups.name: Genetic Rare and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Genetic, Rare and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.purpose: To increase awareness in parliament of genetic, rare and undiagnosed conditions and help to ensure that patients and families affected by those conditions have access to appropriate care and support.

appg_groups.name: Genocide Prevention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group Genocide Prevention
appg_groups.purpose: Providing parliamentarians with the information to act together to prevent genocides and crimes against humanity; learning from past genocides; supporting victims of genocides and crimes against humanity; promoting active peace building.

appg_groups.name: Get Refusal
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Get Refusal
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of women trapped in Jewish Religious marriage and to promote their interests. The APPG will seek to encourage the exchange of knowledge and understanding between

appg_groups.name: Global Deforestation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Deforestation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum to discuss and promote greater awareness of the impacts of global deforestation, for communities, the climate, for nature and human rights. The APPG will consider the UKâ€™s role in contributing to global deforestation, as well as considering UK and international approaches

appg_groups.name: Global Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Education
appg_groups.purpose: UK Parliamentarians working to achieve Sustainable Development Goal 4: to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all.

appg_groups.name: Global Lesbian Gay Bisexual and Transgender LGBT Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT+) Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that global lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT+) issues are permanently part of the governmentâ€™s agenda and the wider national conversation about human rights and equality, raised by well-briefed and motivated parliamentarians both nationally and internationally.

appg_groups.name: Global Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure the full implementation of the International Conference on Population and Development (ICPD) Programme of Action (PoA) to achieve universal access to sexual and reproductive health and rights and sustainable development.

appg_groups.name: Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG's mission is to accelerate progress towards ending the global TB epidemic. We work primarily through the UK parliament to push the UK government to improve its policies on TB and devote more resources to tackling the epidemic.

appg_groups.name: Governance and Inclusive Leadership
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Governance and Inclusive Leadership
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG was set up to identify barriers for ethnic minority people within careers, and help businesses ensure that they are investing in diverse talent. This is an opportunity for the MPs and Peers to get together and support a plan for this agenda and particularly connect with businesses in areas such as Ethnicity Pay Gap Reporting.

appg_groups.name: Grid Networks
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Grid Networks
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is focused on grid sustainability and resilience, policy and legislative challenges relating to power grid capacity in the UK; investment in National Grid infrastructure; planning policy and the development of energy infrastructure; emerging renewable energy systems; and the role of the public and private sector in power grid.

appg_groups.name: Grief Support and the Impact of Death on Society
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Grief Support and the Impact of Death on Society
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together bereavement services, charities, faith communities, health professionals, public sector organisations, and bereaved individuals to: raise awareness across Parliament of the impact of bereavement on adults and children; recognise grief support as a public health issue; and campaign for change for the wellbeing of bereaved people across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Gypsies Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing

appg_groups.name: Hadrians Wall
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hadrian's Wall
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the 150-mile-long UNESCO World Heritage Site and to explore ways of increasing the potential of Hadrianâ€™s Wall as an economic and cultural asset for communities across the North East, Cumbria, and the whole of the UK.

appg_groups.name: Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with blood-borne viruses due to contaminated blood and blood products used in their healthcare treatment.

appg_groups.name: Healthcare Workers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Healthcare Workers
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG aims to highlight key areas of concern for healthcare professionals and discuss potential solutions, including improving the welfare of staff, regulatory changes and legal reform. The group will also aim to promote dialogue and discussion between the healthcare sector and parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Healthy Places
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Healthy Places
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss the role of diverse settings in improving health outcomes, and the potential for services delivered in these settings to create a healthier country.

appg_groups.name: Hemp Carbon Capture and Rural Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hemp Carbon Capture and Rural Development
appg_groups.purpose: To support domestic hemp in achieving the UKâ€™s climate, energy and economic goals - with a particular focus on Sustainable Aviation Fuel, marine biofuels, sustainable construction, carbon credits, farming jobs and rural development. The Group will encourage investment in carbon capture, break down regulatory barriers and support a thriving domestic hemp sector.

appg_groups.name: Heritage Rail
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage Rail
appg_groups.purpose: To brief parliamentarians about heritage railways, the contribution they make to their local and regional economies and the skills training opportunities involved.

appg_groups.name: HIV AIDS and Sexual Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV, AIDS and Sexual Health
appg_groups.purpose: HIV is not yesterday's story. It is with us today in the UK and affecting families all over the world. The APPG believes that as parliamentarians we

appg_groups.name: the Holy See
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
appg_groups.purpose: To foster closer relations between the UK and the Holy See in areas of mutual interest and to ensure MPs and Peers are better informed about the global activities of the Catholic Church.

appg_groups.name: Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG brings together parliamentarians to scrutinise and make recommendations for ending homelessness. Its purpose is to put tackling homelessness at the top of the political agenda and its mission is to help the government deliver an end to all forms of homelessness.

appg_groups.name: Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of adults and children living with terminal or life-limiting conditions, and their families and carers, in parliament; and to promote person-centred, evidence-based policies to improve end of life care in all settings, including hospices, hospitals, care homes, and in people's own homes.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the key issues, opportunities and challenges facing the hospitality and tourism sectors across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality Events Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality, Events, Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To understand and promote the best of Welsh hospitality, events and food and drink, including the visitor economy.

appg_groups.name: Households in Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Households in Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is committed to improving the health, lives and experiences of families and adults living in temporary accommodation across England. The group will highlight the damaging health and educational impact of living in temporary accommodation, especially for children.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

appg_groups.name: Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

appg_groups.name: Hydrogen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hydrogen
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and leading businesses to discuss how to promote the role of large-scale hydrogen projects to enable the UK to meet its net-zero targets.

appg_groups.name: Immigration Detention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Immigration Detention
appg_groups.purpose: To increase knowledge in Parliament on immigration detention in the UK and its impacts; to connect parliamentarians with relevant research, organisations and experts, including people with lived experience of detention; and to advocate for evidence-based policy reforms and the welfare of detained people.

appg_groups.name: Industrial Hemp
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Hemp
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is established to promote the growth and development of the industrial hemp sector in the United Kingdom. It seeks to bring together policymakers, industry representatives, investors, and other stakeholders to support legislative reform and create a conducive environment for the industrial hemp industry to flourish.

appg_groups.name: Industrial Strategy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Strategy
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate cross-party dialogue on the UK's new industrial strategy. The APPG aims to provide a forum for government, businesses and other stakeholders to exchange knowledge of the strategy as it is developed and to ensure it works for all parts of the country.

appg_groups.name: Infant Feeding
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Infant Feeding
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

appg_groups.name: Infrastructure
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
appg_groups.purpose: To highlights the importance of economic infrastructure in the UK amongst parliamentarians, government and industry.

appg_groups.name: Insurance and Financial Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Insurance and Financial Services
appg_groups.purpose: To examine issues of interest to the insurance and broader financial sectors, especially where there are legislative or regulatory implications.

appg_groups.name: Intellectual Property
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Intellectual Property
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property and the importance of its promotion and protection. The Group meets several times a year on topical issues relating to intellectual property.

appg_groups.name: Interfaith Dialogue
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Interfaith Dialogue
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG seeks to promote the practice of unity, cultural exchange and religious understanding in pursuit of community cohesion.

appg_groups.name: International Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to address wildlife conservation and biodiversity issues affecting our planet including but not limited to ecosystem collapse, species extinctions, land degradation, invasive species, illegal fishing and other threats to the natural world.

appg_groups.name: International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG believes that international freedom of religion or belief is a crucial human right. We therefore seek to raise its profile in government, in parliament, in the media and among the general public.

appg_groups.name: International Law Justice and Accountability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Law, Justice and Accountability
appg_groups.purpose: To accommodate discussions and engagement on international law standards and use them to ensure justice and accountability for core international crimes. To work on strengthening the existing mechanisms for the prevention of international crimes, and foster cooperation with international mechanisms.

appg_groups.name: International Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Students
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; to promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and â€˜soft powerâ€™; to raise awareness of issues affecting international students; and to provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, educators, professionals and business leaders.

appg_groups.name: Investment Fraud and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Investment Fraud and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.purpose: To advocate for the victims of financial misconduct, crimes, scandals, frauds and regulatory failures, by driving positive, progressive, and purposeful reforms that achieve a fair, trusted and just system, where the service providers, regulators and government agencies provide appropriate protection and deliver good outcomes, including redress for historical wrongs.

appg_groups.name: Islamic and Ethical Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamic and Ethical Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight and improve areas of Islamic and ethical finance.

appg_groups.name: Kinship Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Kinship Care
appg_groups.purpose: To improve awareness, understanding and support for kinship care. To promote policy and practice which supports more children to live safely in kinship care with family and friends, when they cannot live at home. To amplify the voices and experiences of children and families.

appg_groups.name: Kurds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Kurds
appg_groups.purpose: To develop friendship and understanding of Kurds in the UK and abroad though sharing cultural, economic and social issues through dialogues and discussion; organising events and exchanges between Members and Kurdish communities and community leaders in the UK and abroad.

appg_groups.name: the Leamside Line
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Leamside Line
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign for the re-opening of the Leamside Line in full, which would provide significant economic, social and environmental benefits for the North-East of England and positively impact the East Coast Main Line ensuring an uplift in capacity.

appg_groups.name: Learning Disability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Learning Disability
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the issues faced by people with a learning disability and by their families. The group explores the key issues of the day, across areas including health, social care, education, employment and benefits.

appg_groups.name: Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to leasehold and commonhold legislation and regulation. Reduce opportunities for exploitation and improve cladding. Review the leasehold property Tribunal as a low-cost forum for disputes and redress including leasehold insurance and service charges which fall outside FCA (Financial Conduct Authority) regulation. Meet with and monitor government departments and publicly funded bodies working on leasehold.

appg_groups.name: Legal and Constitutional Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal and Constitutional Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and build understanding of legal and constitutional issues, and provide a source of debate and expertise on these subjects.

appg_groups.name: the Less Survivable Cancers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Less Survivable Cancers
appg_groups.purpose: To create a forum to raise political awareness of issues affecting patients with a less survivable cancer â€“ in particular cancers of the brain, liver, lungs, pancreas, oesophagus and stomach â€“ and to advocate for actions to improve survival rates.

appg_groups.name: Life Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation and the important role of charities, industry, and academies in supporting and funding medical research and commercialisation to the benefit of patients across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Listed Properties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
appg_groups.purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties, including tax and planning reform.

appg_groups.name: Liver Disease and Liver Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Liver Disease and Liver Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of liver disease and liver cancer with parliamentarians and government, and to advocate for policy change to transform outcomes for liver patients, reduce health inequalities, and ensure the voices of people with lived experience are heard at Westminster.

appg_groups.name: Local Government
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

appg_groups.name: Local Markets
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Markets
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a conduit for the markets industry to advance the case for markets and to raise issues about their welfare. It provides a forum for discussions about policy, strategy and operational issues recognising the role of markets and market trading in retail, tourism, employment, hospitality, and leisure sectors.

appg_groups.name: London
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is a forum for MPs and Peers to work together on a cross-party basis to strengthen the capital's voice in Parliament. The groupâ€™s purpose is to promote the capital in the interests of all Londoners.

appg_groups.name: Long Covid
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Long Covid
appg_groups.purpose: To work with like-minded MPs and organisations to research the prevalence of Long Covid; assess and request scientific research and medical inquiries; raise awareness of the profound impacts on millions of people worldwide; and outlining our asks to government.

appg_groups.name: Magnitsky Sanctions and Reparation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Magnitsky Sanctions and Reparation
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of human rights and anti-corruption sanctions within parliament, to examine specific situations where sanctions may be appropriate, and to consider changes to the operation of the UKâ€™s Magnitsky Sanctions legislation to improve its efficiency and impact.

appg_groups.name: Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of malaria and neglected tropical diseases in Parliament, to champion solutions and tools to prevent, treat, control, and eliminate them, and to strengthen cross-party Parliamentary support for UK leadership, investment, and mobilisation of political will as the world works towards the shared 2030 Sustainable Development Goals.

appg_groups.name: Marine Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Marine Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, supply chain and energy security benefits from the development of marine energy resources in and around the UK.

appg_groups.name: Maritime and Ports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maritime and Ports
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the exchange of views between parliamentarians and leading figures in the shipping, ports and maritime business industries.

appg_groups.name: Maternity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maternity
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the value of maternity services to the health and wellbeing of women and babies as well as to a wider society, and to identify and push for improvements across the entire maternity pathway, specifically including making birth safer and the elimination of inequalities.

appg_groups.name: Media Freedom
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Media Freedom
appg_groups.purpose: To promote media freedom in countries around the world and to strengthen the protection of journalists.

appg_groups.name: Medical Cannabis Under Prescription
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Medical Cannabis Under Prescription
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG exists to promote the importance of medical cannabis for patients in the UK. To raise awareness of the industry and the importance to growth of the economy and jobs within the sector. To work with other parties within government to raise awareness of this medication and the importance for patients, to help create an understanding of how this medication could sit within current medical frameworks.

appg_groups.name: Men and Boys Issues
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Men and Boys' Issues
appg_groups.purpose: 'To raise awareness of disadvantages and poor outcomes faced by men and boys in education, mental and physical health and law; to influence attitudes, role models, policy and legislation that will lead to positive differences to their well-being and lives.

appg_groups.name: Menopause
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Menopause
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a platform to tackle the lack of understanding around Menopause amongst policymakers, the public and employers. The Group also provides a platform in Parliament that highlights the issues and challenges around menopause that deserve attention, as well as acting as a forum for discussion.

appg_groups.name: Mental Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mental Health
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about issues relating to mental health, and to advocate for policies which will improve mental health in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Micromobility
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Micromobility
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss regulation in the micromobility sector as part of decarbonising our transport system; discuss good regulation and practice already taking place and where it can be improved; identify where government can include micromobility regulation in upcoming legislation; advocate for safety of pedestrians and road users in relation to micromobility.

appg_groups.name: Microplastics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Microplastics
appg_groups.purpose: To further the discussion around the potential harms of microplastics, raise awareness of these harms and provide suggestions for how they can be mitigated â€“ such as via microplastic filters in washing machines.

appg_groups.name: Migration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Migration
appg_groups.purpose: To support the emergence of mainstream, progressive policy debate on migration in the UK parliament.

appg_groups.name: Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.purpose: To review and explore potential miscarriages of justice, including scrutiny of the criminal appeals system and highlighting concerns over the ability to redress injustices.

appg_groups.name: Modern Conflict
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Conflict
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is an interest group for parliamentarians considering the capabilities and commitments driving contemporary warfare. Our work advances discussion and policy-making regarding protection considerations, technology, covert operations, and other issues which are outpacing conventional oversight mechanisms in the context of modern conflict.

appg_groups.name: Modern Languages
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Languages
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the benefits of learning and using languages throughout the UK; provide a parliamentary forum for information exchange and consultation on languages and linguists; encourage and support policies and action improving the take-up of languages in schools, further and higher education, in the workplace and in the community.

appg_groups.name: Modernising Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modernising Employment
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG brings together Parliamentarians with organisations that have a shared interest in understanding how the UK labour market can lead the world in driving growth and providing a level playing field for everyone.

appg_groups.name: Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To increase awareness and understanding of motor neurone disease (MND) amongst parliamentarians, to provide a forum for discussion of the challenges facing people living with and affected by MND and to campaign for better access to high quality services for people affected by MND..

appg_groups.name: Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.purpose: To advocate on behalf of and alongside people affected by MS (Multiple Sclerosis) and to promote the interests of people in the MS community.

appg_groups.name: Music
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a discussion forum between the music industry, parliamentarians and their constituencies.

appg_groups.name: Music Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music Education
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians engaging in discussions relating to music education through early years, primary, secondary, special educational needs and disabilities (SEND), further and higher education, and lifelong learning. The APPG has a particular focus on curriculum, music hubs, challenges facing higher education, and progression into the creative and cultural sector.

appg_groups.name: Mutuals
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mutuals
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and support mutuals.

appg_groups.name: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis ME
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME)
appg_groups.purpose: Seeks to improve health, social care, education and employment opportunities for people with ME and encourage biomedical research into the cause and treatment of ME.

appg_groups.name: the National Trust
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the National Trust
appg_groups.purpose: To apply parliamentary scrutiny to the operational and strategic direction of the National Trust.

appg_groups.name: New Towns
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on New Towns
appg_groups.purpose: To celebrate the UKâ€™s New Towns, identify common challenges and make the case for investment and sustainable growth. This APPG will examine how to best support the needs of the 2.8 million people already living in new towns and consider the needs of the residents of the future. Learning the lessons from past new towns in championing and supporting the creation of more new towns.

appg_groups.name: the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party voice to champion nightlifeâ€™s cultural and economic importance. To promote policy opportunities and solutions, working in partnership with cross-sector stakeholders. To support and unlock equitable growth through the Night Time Economy (NTE). To protect and support NTE spaces and ecosystems from immediate threats.

appg_groups.name: Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the opportunities and challenges currently facing the civil nuclear sector to better understand, support and call for further development of new nuclear across the UK on a cross-party basis.

appg_groups.name: Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of global malnutrition in Parliament and champion solutions to end it, to strengthen cross-party parliamentary support for UK investment in nutrition and food security, and to support and challenge the UK government to maintain their leadership on global nutrition and food security.

appg_groups.name: Obesity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Obesity
appg_groups.purpose: To generate a public policy environment where obesity is recognised and prioritised; hold government to account for the delivery of an obesity

appg_groups.name: Obstructive Sleep Apnoea
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Obstructive Sleep Apnoea
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Obstructive Sleep Apnoea and its treatment.

appg_groups.name: Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG holds meetings, receptions and events to discuss contemporary risks and hazards in the modern workplace. We publish reports and recommendations, and regularly hear from experts on a range of issues including asbestos, fire safety, occupational stress, and regulation.

appg_groups.name: the Ocean
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Ocean
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a collective space where all parliamentarians can support and promote ocean research and awareness, to develop greater understanding of the ocean and its role in tackling challenges such as climate change, and to debate wider ocean issues.

appg_groups.name: Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.purpose: To support the continued development of open banking, payments, open finance and smart data solutions in the new Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of osteoporosis amongst parliamentarians and to influence legislation and policy makers to improve the lives of people living with the condition. The APPG will consider how to promote behavioural change and systems changes so people of all ages can strengthen their bones and prevent osteoporosis.

appg_groups.name: Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for open debate on pandemic management, to prevent avoidable suffering and loss in the future and ensure public health measures are proportional to the risk. To scrutinise the safety and regulatory approval of Covid-19 vaccines and review financial arrangements for anyoneharmed or bereaved by them.

appg_groups.name: PANS PANDAS
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on PANS PANDAS
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the conditions PANS (Pediatric Acute-onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome) and PANDAS (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal Infections) and advocate for support for PANS PANDAS children and their families.

appg_groups.name: Parents
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Parents
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the role of parents.

appg_groups.name: Park Homes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Park Homes
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians, park homeowners and industry representatives to discuss issues of common interest including legislation and its enforcement to eliminate abuse and disadvantage.

appg_groups.name: Parkinsons
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkinson's

appg_groups.name: Young Carers and Young Adult Carers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Young Carers and Young Adult Carers
appg_groups.purpose: A forum for key issues affecting young carers and young adult carers,

appg_groups.name: Youth Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of issues that affect and concern young people, encourage dialogue between parliamentarians, young people and youth services, and encourage a co-ordinated and coherent approach to youth policy making.

appg_groups.name: Youth Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Youth Employment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote youth employment in all its forms and the role of young people within the economy; to ensure that young people's voices are heard; to highlight the need for quality opportunities; and to share best practice.

appg_groups.name: Zoos and Aquariums
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Zoos and Aquariums
appg_groups.purpose: The discussion of issues pertaining to zoos and aquariums, including but not limited to conservation, animal welfare, nature-access and environmental issues.
